S. Korean Peasants' General Strike Hailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Peasants' General Strike Hailed 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Federation of south Korean Trade Unions reportedly issued a statement on Oct. 28 in support of the struggle of peasants against the forced passage of the "bill on rice negotiations".
 Recalling that the sycophantic "bill on rice negotiations" was passed through the Unification, Diplomacy and Trade Committee of the "National Assembly" in ten minutes on Oct. 27 despite a strong protest of the peasants, the statement said that the large-scale general strike of the peasants staged in different parts of south Korea was a righteous protest to defend the food sovereignty and the vital rights of the peasants. The Federation of south Korean Trade Unions extends positive support to their struggle, it noted.    
 It stressed that the "government" and the NA should not leave the rice market to the mercy of the foreign forces but take fundamental measures to protect the living of the peasants and revive agriculture.

articles.title: Punishment of GI Murderers Urged
articles.content:
Punishment of GI Murderers Urged 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for the Implementation of the South-North Joint Declaration in south Korea reportedly issued a statement titled "Punish GI murderers" on Oct. 28.
 The statement recalled that GI murderers, who mercilessly drove a car over woman Kim Myong Ja to death in Tongduchon City of Kyonggi Province in June last, were acquitted without  punishment. The statement deplored the reality of south Korea where even if Koreans were killed by foreigners , the murderers could neither be brought before the court nor be punished. 
 A cycle of criminal evils will continue as long as there remain the U.S. troops in south Korea, it said, urging the immediate abolition of the humiliating and slavish "south Korea-U.S. Status of Forces Agreement" and the complete withdrawal of the U.S. forces from this land.

Greetings to Algerian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Algerian President 
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Algerian President Abdelaziz Bouteflika on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the start of the Algerian revolution.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Algeria will grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the friendly Algerian people greater progress and prosperity.

articles.title: DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for Cuba, Venezuela and Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK Government Economic Delegation Leaves for Cuba, Venezuela and Brazil
    Pyongyang, October 31 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government economic delegation led by Minister of Foreign Trade Rim Kyong Man left here today for Cuba, Venezuela and Brazil.
 The delegation was seen off at Pyongyang Railway Station by Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Myong San and Cuban Ambassador to the DPRK Ruben Perez Valdes.
